	Hi Danie
	Fundamentally the issue is that Worldwide has found itself absorbing all costs of all companies when the cards all expired in Aug 2023 2 weeks after Kayla's murder. As an emergency measure the expenses were put on the Worldwide cards which had a different expiry date. This is why RegimA Skin Treatments and Strategic have no record of their actual computer expenses. Eerything was dumped in Worldwide. The majority of these tranasactions belong in Rezonance, a technology and IT company Kayla and I spent nearly a decade building. As an IT company and service provider, the operating expenses are essentially different from a skincare distribution company, so an operating expense for the former would often be considered capital expenditure in the latter etc. As you can see from the ProfitandLoss.pdf Rezonance made its first annual profit in Feb 2023 which Kayla and I celebrated as all the hard work finally paying off. Rezonance currently owes me ZAR 1.8 million as a director from my investments over the years, you can understand why I firmly rejected Pete's insistence that I just close the company. In addition there was an ongoing murder investigation where the authorities reminded me of the familiar firearms rule that life comes before property and instructed me to freeze all activity immediately while they conducted their investigations and resolve the financial issues later. Which is exactly what I have done.
	Further to the question of necessity to the business, as can be seen from the ProfitandLossReport (RWD).pdf RegimA Worldwide Distribution absorbed the operational overhead of 4 large distribution partners between 2020 and 2023. It did so with no additional staff as I single-handedly rebuilt the entire demand side of the distribution function into the marketplace and ecommerce platforms to allow continuity of business in the wake of cascading failure of our distribution partners. The margins are structured so that each hub uses its margin to cover the costs. The recent moves to take all of the payments directly into an account which only Rynette has access to and deny me any visibility while leaving all the expenses with me are not only bizarre but will ultimately prevent us from ever being able to resolve anything while placing someone who is neither a director or employee of Worldwide Distribution in complete control without any liability. This is conerning as it makes me as a director liable for their actions without my knowledge or consent. This cannot continue.
	As can be seen in the Worldwide Distribution P&L, the year-on-year turnover increase from 2M to 12M to 19M reflects the additional distribution activity it took on over the period.
	The significant drop of 1M to 18M the following year was after Pete signed an affidavit to make himself the administrator on the Worldwide accounts and all my automations were unhooked. I informed Pete and Rynette prior to this not to touch it or it would break the automations but they did so anyway. I informed them after that I could no longer see the things i needed to complete the accounts and that they need to ensure they know what they are doing. Over the past year the bank contacted me on several occasions to ask for my approval where Pete and Rynette had attempted to draft mandates to change the ownership structure, have my accounts closed and cancel my cards, all without my knowledge or consent. I informed the bank these must be errors and informed both Pete and Rynette to cease this activity immediately.
	As you can see in AccountTransactionsReport.pdf the correct format up to Aug 2023 shows invoices from Rezonance which group the services with itemized billing. This involves a 10% mark-up for Rezonance managed services which I use to also cover the account processing where I have a system that remunerates R50 for whoever is managing the 3rd party service for each invoice, ensuring its line items, forex rates etc are correctly filled in on quickbooks for comprehensive records. After Aug 2023 you can see all items are allocated to FNB which is the auto bank feed i have on Worldwide accounts. 
	The actual companies RegimA Zone and RegimA SA that operate the Shopify systems were configured to operate the distribution functions using trust accounts and RegimA SA with Pete and I as directors was doing this with Dermal (Barend) and RegimA Zone (Only me as director) was an aggregation of 3 smaller distributions. I had specifically structured it this way to prevent Pete from doing to me what he did to Kachan, simply taking the revenue for himself by instructing people to pay into another account (which is basically what has happened). The problem is that since the ownership of the companies is not the same (i.e. I am not a member of RegimA Skin Treatments and the other companies are not subsidiaries), therefore there is no fixed "group" or intercompany and moving assets from a company where I am a director to a company where I am not is essentially theft or at the very least fraudulent for tax purposes. I urge you to keep this in mind as these issues should not be dismissed as "family disputes" when there is a distinct material and legal difference between ownership of companies which should be treated as such.
	I have been telling both Pete and Rynette for 4 years now that the outstanding amounts owed to Rezonance need to be paid before I am able to purchase the services and continue as normal, attached is the Rezonance Febr 2023.PDF showing over 1M outstanding owed by RegimA Skin Treatments to Rezonance. I have been telling Pete for over a year that I cannot file the accounts for Rezonance until the errors of 2024 are corrected in RegimA Skin Treatments. RST has had an account with GoDaddy since 2014 which is also an international payments account with some forex etc. For reasons I can only speculate, in 2024 Rynette made the debt to Rezonance "disappear" by misallocating international GoDaddy payments as though they were local payments made to Rezonance, yet Rezonance received no such payments (the amounts are still outstanding). I was explaining to Pete that these need to be corrected before I submit Rezonance accounts as there will immediately be a mismatch showing Rezonance never received the payments and they will flag as fraudulent on RegimA Skin Treatments with SARS. This was just ignored and they opted instead to try and close my accounts and dissolve my company. This cannot continue.
	To the best of my understanding the course we need to follow for correct accounts is:

	1.	
		Inform SARS about my freezing activity on the accounts in cooperaion with law enforcement for the murder inquiry
	2.	
		Explain that we are now in the process of updating the affected records to reconcile the past 2 years so it reflects an accurate account
	3.	
		Make the payments from RegimA Skin Treatments to Rezonance and correctly allocate the 2014 GoDaddy expenses to GoDaddy
	4.	
		Process the Invoices in the same way I had been doing up until Aug 2023 so there is a single invoice from Rezonance each month.
	5.	
		Configure the Paystack systems on Shopify to split the payments directly into Distrivbution and Manufacturer accounts.

	Other than that I can't see any other way to properly remedy the situation. We cannot just try to shoehorn an entire architecture for multiple distribution operations into one account. The transactions on RegimA Skin Treatments must not be signed off as they will later show up as fraudulent. Bear in mind that Pete does not use the computer and has never seen the actual accounts for the company, nor has Jacqui and nor have I. They exist solely on Rynette's computer and nobody else is able to see them. 	Subject: The RegimA Group results and Computer Expense analysis
	Good morning Pete, Jacqui and Danny
	It saddens me to write this email this morning, as in my 30-odd year involvement with the Faucitt family business I have never had to encounter or get involved with an internal dispute of this serious nature. 
	Although perhaps difficult for you as family members, I suggest we try and keep the emotions at bay and resolve this dispute regarding the spend on Computer related expenses by applying basic business principles in deciding what needs to be done to restore the profitability and ultimate survival of the business going forward. What do you think?
	Just a friendly request please, not to send me any relevant information and comments privately. We all need to be working as a team to be able to ascertain the potential problem/s and focus on finding the most viable solution/s.
	Danny has responded to my email of 26th May, his email attached. Danny, many thanks for the very professional and detailed analyses you have provided. 
	I would still like for the Excel printouts I've attached to be answered line by line please.
	Your email contains a lot of information. It is a lot to digest. By doing a category analysis helps tremendously to understand the nature and purpose of all the various IT related services and platforms that are used throughout the RegimA Group. 
	I am neither an IT expert, nor am I an e-Commerce expert so I would not be able to comment on the necessity, use and value each expense adds to the company. 
	What is clear though, is that the RegimA group has over the past few years invested heavily in IT and e-commerce platforms and continues to do so. For any business to spend in excess of 20% of revenue generated on these services, the spend needs to be justified, transparent, relevant and needs to add the desired value to the business, i.e. it has to benefit the "bottom line".
	Insofar as these computer expenses are concerned, I suggest we need to ask ourselves these questions to start off with:
	1. Do we have the necessary invoices for each expense to be able to satisfy a SARS investigation?
	2. Verify what each expense is used for on a daily basis?
	3. Confirm the sales volume and value generated by each and every e-commerce platform the company is paying for.
	4. Consider the relevance and necessity of all collaboration, communication, marketing, development , AI services as well as Analytics & Monitoring tools and do a cost-benefit analysis.on each and every service paid for.
	The other concerning aspect is that from my high-level analysis of the state of the finances of the RegimA Group as at 28 February 2025, it is concerning to notice that the Group has, for the first time in its history, made a substantial trading loss in the past financial year. 
	This reflects in the bank balances as well, which saw a decline of R10m year-on-year for the Group, including Villa Via. 
	So, besides considering Computer Expenses, other aspects of the business like product margins, selling and distribution costs etc. needs to be looked at in depth again.
	This will hopefully be the start of an in-depth discussion regarding the profitability and ultimate future viability of the business.

	Kind regards,
	Danie Bantjes

It was good to meet you yesterday.  I have obtained copies of the title and lease to the property, which I attach.

There is no restriction on the company’s ability to assign the lease.  There are obviously ongoing requirements to pay the £50 per year ground rent and the service charge, which I assume are in hand.

From: Neil Allen [mailto:Neil.Allen@begbies-traynor.com]
Sent: 10 August 2016 15:41
To: Christopher Tayton <ctayton@clarkslegal.com <mailto:ctayton@clarkslegal.com> >
Cc: Julie Palmer <Julie.Palmer@begbies-traynor.com <mailto:Julie.Palmer@begbies-traynor.com> >
Subject: RE: Simply Regima Ltd - In Liquidation

Dear Mr Tayton

I will try to address your points in the order of your letter.  Firstly, please could you confirm who you act for?

In a previous letter/email you said it was Regima @ Dr H but in your recent communication you suggest they are not a creditor.

Also, in your below email you said:

We are working with our client on the response. It is taking a little longer than expected as the paperwork is very detailed.

We should be grateful if you would bear with us until Wednesday 22 June 2016 to respond.

It would appear you have gone through an exercise of gathering and reviewing paperwork.  Therefore, if you could provide copies of the same and put that into context it might assist us.

1 & 2

I have emails on file from Daniel Faucitt sent throughout May 2015 where he refers to himself as the sole director of Regima @ Dr H.  This does not fit your timeline of Regima Zone processing distribution and negotiating new terms with Simply Regima during early 2015.  Furthermore, you state that Regima @ Dr H didn’t cease distributing products until January/February 2016.  This is all very confusing.  Do you have any contemporaneous evidence that will add clarity to this situation?

3

Simply Regima made a payment of £13k to Regima Zone on 1 May 2015.  Regima Zone maintain this was due on 30 April 2015 (not 30 April 2016 as you mistakenly write).  However, nothing has been provided to support this as being a breach of any contract terms.  I can only infer that such evidence does not exist.  Simply Regima enjoyed 5 years of successful trading prior to the arrival of Regima Zone – it’s hard not to form a link between the two events.  I cannot entertain the idea that Simply Regima was late in making payment without an agreed contract setting out the accepted terms.

4

The statement provided by Regima Zone shows three invoices being raised post 1 May 2015 – the invoices are worth a total of £763.94.  Can you produce any copy purchase orders or communications that prove Ms Burrey circumvented the normal procedure and somehow tricked staff into fulfilling these orders?  Similarly can you produce any communications that set out the correct procedure for placing orders and demonstrate those were acknowledged by Ms Burrey and/or Simply Regima?  Without evidence it’s impossible to form an opinion as to whether this was due to devious behaviour by Simply Regima or simply a lack of controls within Regima Zone.  But considering the sum involved it would hardly seem commercially worthwhile spending too much time reviewing this.

5

Noted.

6 & 8

The statement of affairs proved to be incorrect.  I can confirm that the company’s bank account was overdrawn by £4k at the time of liquidation.  Ms Burrey has explained that Simply Regima traded exclusively in Regima products.  I have now interrogated the bank statements and they support this position.  There is no evidence that payments were made to other creditors/suppliers or that Ms Burrey benefitted from the demise of Simply Regima at the expense of its creditors.

7

As before, I fail to see how this is relevant or suggests any fraudulent activity on the part of Ms Burrey or Simply Regima.  I can confirm that Simply Regima did purchase a centrifuge and that this was given to a client.  Until recently the centrifuge has been at the client’s premises but it has since been returned to Ms Burrey.  The centrifuge is an asset owned by Simply Regima and will be realised by the liquidators.  Considering the value when new (£1,800) two years ago, I do not think this realisation is a game changer.  But it will go some way to extinguishing our fees.

9

As explained above and previously, Ms Burrey is personally liable for the account of Simply Regima.  And bearing in mind that I have been able to confirm Simply Regima had no other suppliers/creditors to prefer, I cannot see any instance of preference.  The bank statements are that of a very consistent and simple nature – money is received from customers then wages and overheads are paid in the normal course of business.  There is nothing to suggest wrong doing.  There is no activity on the account after May 2015, it would seem the business was not trading but simply in limbo awaiting some form of winding-up action.

I would add that Simply Regima had no dealings in business with Danielle De Winter.  It would appear that since the liquidation Ms Burrey has forged a relationship with Danielle De Winter that is in no way linked to the insolvency.  There is nothing sinister or concerning about this.  I have been contacted by Danielle De Winter as someone linked to Regima (I cannot categorically say your client as I don’t know who that is) has contacted them and made factually incorrect remarks about the liquidation of Simply Regima and Ms Burrey.  There is nothing to be gained from this rather risky behaviour.

I consider that the liquidator has completed the necessary investigation.  This liquidation is ready to be closed once the centrifuge is sold and our fees and expenses have been paid.

I do not propose to keep going over the same points or reading into hearsay without evidence.  It serves no purpose and does not benefit creditors.  There is no cause of action here.

Should you be able to produce any compelling evidence that does give rise to a possible recovery action please let me know.

Otherwise I will proceed toward closure without further reference to you.

Yours sincerely

Neil Allen

From: Neil Allen [mailto:Neil.Allen@begbies-traynor.com]
Sent: 22 June 2016 10:31
To: Christopher Tayton <ctayton@clarkslegal.com <mailto:ctayton@clarkslegal.com> >
Subject: RE: Simply Regima Ltd - In Liquidation

Dear Christopher

From the correspondence you have reviewed you will note that disappointingly your client has never confirmed the date the sub-distribution agreement was terminated and on what grounds it was terminated.  This will assist in establishing a date of insolvency, without which potential claims for preference, wrongful trading and misfeasance are unlikely to succeed. 

I should be grateful if your client would respond fully on this point.  As your client had taken action to place orders on hold and threatened winding-up proceedings, I trust they can be clear on this and provide a timely response.

Responding to the points in your letter:

1)

My investigations in this respect remain ongoing and I will respond more fully in due course.  You should note that Ms Burrey was personally liable for the company's bank overdraft.  Therefore, I struggle to get my head round why your client believes Ms Burrey would increase the overdraft to prefer other creditors, when she is only making her personal position worse.

On a similar note, please see attached. 

I should be grateful if you would ask your client to explain why Laura Puttick was advising customers of the company to make payments to them.  Those debts should have been paid to the liquidators for the benefit of creditors as a whole.  I have also attached an account statement that shows various payments received by your client between 10 June and 18 June.  Who did these payments come from?  Were they payments made by customers of the company as a result of Laura Puttick's intervention?

2)

a)  Noted.

b)  In paragraph (a) you state that Jeunesse, Enerzona and Danielle De Winter were suppliers to the company.  You go on to state that payments to those suppliers was not for the commercial benefit of the company.  I think this requires further clarification as I fail to understand how paying a company's suppliers does not benefit that company commercially.

Also, in an account where receipts are mixed, how does your client expect to establish that the company (not Ms Burrey) used funds received specifically from the sale of Regima products to pay those suppliers?  Furthermore, why is the source of funds important?

c)  Please provide the evidence referred to so the liquidators can consider this further.

3)

The liquidators have already submitted their return to DBIS, the content of that return is confidential.  However, your client's comments and concerns have been taken into consideration, thank you for your assistance and co-operation to date.

Yours sincerely

Neil Allen

Dear Sir / Madam

I write to confirm receipt of your letter.

I look forward to receiving your findings/thoughts and an update on your client's claim in the liquidation in due course.  The liquidation will remain open for a reasonable amount of time to allow this.  However, it will not be left open indefinitely.  Therefore, I ask that in the first instance you provide more information within 28 days.

Your client has made a number of vague accusations but has failed to provide any evidence in support of them, despite my requests.  At the same time I have not had a response to my questions surrounding the timing of the sub-distribution agreement being terminated and the grounds for that termination.

I have spent considerable time corresponding with your client and it should be noted that any claim they have would be against a company already in liquidation.  And any claim the company in liquidation may have against Ms Burrey would belong to the liquidators.  The liquidators currently have unpaid time costs of circa £8k and any realisations would first be utilised to pay those outstanding costs as a liquidation expense.  Therefore, it's worth taking into consideration the likely outcome and commerciality of what your client hopes to achieve.

Yours faithfully

﻿From:	"Daniel Faucitt" <d@rzo.io>
Sent:	29/08/2025 13:01:08
To:	 <smunga@ensafrica.com>; "j faucitt" <jfaucitt@proton.me>
Subject:	Fw: update - Some Initial Information & Operating Entity Lists
Attachments:	AccountTransactionsReport.pdfComputer Expenses Categorization Report (Corrected).pdfProfitAndLossReport (RWD).pdfmonthly_spending_trend.pngProfitandLoss.pdfRezonance Febr 2023.PDF

________________________________
From: Danie Bantjes <danie.bantjes@gmail.com>
Sent: 06 June 2025 2:30 PM
To: Danie Bantjes <danieb@quatro.co.za>
Subject: Fwd: update - Some Initial Information & Operating Entity Lists 

Kind regards, 
Danie Bantjes

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Daniel Faucitt <d@rzo.io <mailto:d@rzo.io> >
Date: Fri, 6 Jun 2025 at 13:00
Subject: Re: update - Some Initial Information & Operating Entity Lists
To: Danie Bantjes <danie.bantjes@gmail.com <mailto:danie.bantjes@gmail.com> >, Jacqui Faucitt <jax@regima.zone>
Cc: Daniel Faucitt (dan@regima.zone) <dan@regima.zone>, Daniel Faucitt <d@rzo.io <mailto:d@rzo.io> >

Hi Danie
I have been going over the figures you sent and trying to make sense of the current perceived view as compared with the actual situation in order to converge on an accurate representation of how the companies work together over the span of supply chain activities. Most notably that since I las did the accounts myself in July 2023 it appears everything is just showing up as supplier "FNB" in Worldwide (default for the bank feed) indicating that nobody has actually processed any of those accounts since Aug 2023. As a result, everything is in the wrong companies and nothing has been reconciled..
!!! Important !!! I notice that from the one account detail I can see in RegimA Skin Treatments, a minimum of just over a million has been misallocated resulting in vanishing debt. This and likely other issues needs to be urgently rectified as if submitted as is it may be viewed as fraudulent by the receiver since it misreports forex transactions by the same amount.
There are many other issues which I will address in order of urgency in follow-up mails but had to send you something in the meantime. Below I list the companies as Legal Entities as well as the registry for Quickbooks and 2 ZA Shopify hubs.. there are more for UK and EU.. but for now I need to try and give you an idea of the broader perspective.
There is a great deal missing from the full picture including the context of the 2 Marketplaces, 4 Distribution platforms with 36 Shopify Stores and over 1100 B2B Salon Tenants.
Also the 4 Companies that operate these Distribution hubs are generating sales figures and populating acounts which you have never seen as far as i know..
Firstly, I added a whole reference library of supporting documents, templates and analyses that will be useful for refining a relevant operating framework.
For the moment there is a temporary site here with detailed info related to computer related categorization:    https://lsdhynli.manus.space/ <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__lsdhynli.manus.space_&d=DwMGaQ&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=7ZULBZmD5L4dM8U3nU-5WA&m=7_Ivr5xaM2QfP5v3PVzYHTWaKHioLVmKhy6lSencTU_0OrxlZKcOIK5Wa_xbD6Mp&s=2usNXrMM0zaqxDWuityNP9YU8xwxpEJ14kjZpDRvtow&e=> 
In addition here is a work-in-progress dashboard of the whole supply chain with its 3 primary systems:    Hypergraph B2B Integration System Simulation <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__hypergraph-2Db-2D2-2Db-2Dintegration-2Dsystem-2Dsimulation-2Ddrzo.replit.app_&d=DwMGaQ&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=7ZULBZmD5L4dM8U3nU-5WA&m=7_Ivr5xaM2QfP5v3PVzYHTWaKHioLVmKhy6lSencTU_0OrxlZKcOIK5Wa_xbD6Mp&s=VqGAR8lN7UvjHCSwjxqwuLXyvMSjiijyJvrBQPCZbgs&e=> 
Below D, J, P are Dan, Jax & Pete Director / Shareholder indicators.. so there are 4 Legally distinct groups between which simple intercompany transactions require additional transactions in order to justify asset transfer etc.

Cc: Daniel Faucitt (dan@regima.zone) <dan@regima.zone>, Daniel Faucitt <d@rzo.io <mailto:d@rzo.io> >

Hi Danie
I have been going over the figures you sent and trying to make sense of the current perceived view as compared with the actual situation in order to converge on an accurate representation of how the companies work together over the span of supply chain activities. Most notably that since I las did the accounts myself in July 2023 it appears everything is just showing up as supplier "FNB" in Worldwide (default for the bank feed) indicating that nobody has actually processed any of those accounts since Aug 2023. As a result, everything is in the wrong companies and nothing has been reconciled..
!!! Important !!! I notice that from the one account detail I can see in RegimA Skin Treatments, a minimum of just over a million has been misallocated resulting in vanishing debt. This and likely other issues needs to be urgently rectified as if submitted as is it may be viewed as fraudulent by the receiver since it misreports forex transactions by the same amount.
There are many other issues which I will address in order of urgency in follow-up mails but had to send you something in the meantime. Below I list the companies as Legal Entities as well as the registry for Quickbooks and 2 ZA Shopify hubs.. there are more for UK and EU.. but for now I need to try and give you an idea of the broader perspective.
There is a great deal missing from the full picture including the context of the 2 Marketplaces, 4 Distribution platforms with 36 Shopify Stores and over 1100 B2B Salon Tenants.
Also the 4 Companies that operate these Distribution hubs are generating sales figures and populating acounts which you have never seen as far as i know..
Firstly, I added a whole reference library of supporting documents, templates and analyses that will be useful for refining a relevant operating framework.
For the moment there is a temporary site here with detailed info related to computer related categorization:    https://lsdhynli.manus.space/ <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__lsdhynli.manus.space_&d=DwMGaQ&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=7ZULBZmD5L4dM8U3nU-5WA&m=g1v8aCfanmj9oOBmWIdLbPYYuOsR6bDVPcoNPYnU6gpJ4QnQM4wjOt26_vVWLBpV&s=0ZZ9LUy02YHcwkGBhEnfrNtcF0E-GGy24wZmOlJXfko&e=> 
In addition here is a work-in-progress dashboard of the whole supply chain with its 3 primary systems:    Hypergraph B2B Integration System Simulation <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__hypergraph-2Db-2D2-2Db-2Dintegration-2Dsystem-2Dsimulation-2Ddrzo.replit.app_&d=DwMGaQ&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=7ZULBZmD5L4dM8U3nU-5WA&m=g1v8aCfanmj9oOBmWIdLbPYYuOsR6bDVPcoNPYnU6gpJ4QnQM4wjOt26_vVWLBpV&s=Cq30I4M0sXxLMD1mRbtYWp1G5J1PerEHmBwfxuxjNSo&e=>
